name: Against Malaria Foundation
mission: We help protect people from malaria We fund long-lasting insecticidal nets LLINs and work with distribution partners to ensure they are used. We track and report on net use and impact.
theoryOfChange: The Against Malaria Foundation (AMF) has a detailed 'Our Process' page on its website that outlines its strategic framework. This document describes how AMF operates, from receiving funds to distributing long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs) and monitoring their impact. The process involves discussions with National Malaria Control Programmes (NMCPs) and other organizations to establish net need and accountability. AMF partners with in-country organizations for distribution and ensures rigorous monitoring and evaluation, including pre-distribution surveys, independent supervision during distribution, and post-distribution check-ups (PDCUs) to assess net usage and condition over time. AMF's approach is guided by principles of efficiency, transparency, and demonstrating impact, with a clear focus on measurable outcomes such as nets distributed, people protected, lives saved, and malaria cases averted.

evaluationSources: The Life You Can Save - Top Rated 2012 to 2025

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is rated as medium-low because the organization serves a general humanitarian cause with high urgency but lacks specific features for Muslim donors beyond general sadaqah eligibility [7]. The cause is recognized for its global health importance, though it does not target specific religious or cultural demographics [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates moderate impact through its focus on capacity building and large-scale net distribution, supported by detailed technical reports on net usage and hanging status [4][5]. While it maintains a high Charity Navigator score of 94.0/100, the direct cost per beneficiary data is not currently specified in the baseline metrics [1].

Rigorous post-distribution monitoring and technical reporting
baseline_narrative.summary: The Against Malaria Foundation (US) focuses on the procurement and distribution of long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs) to protect populations at high risk of malaria [3]. In the most recent fiscal period, the organization reported a total revenue of $62,286,888 while maintaining a program expense ratio of 100.0% [1][2].

confidence.notes: Very high financial transparency but limited governance depth.

alignment.explanation: While the charity operates in <cite id="3">Muslim-majority regions</cite> such as Guinea and Burkina Faso, it has <cite id="16">low specific alignment</cite> with religious donor requirements.
alignment.improvement: The charity could <cite id="20">clearly state its policy regarding sadaqah</cite> or clarify if any programs are structured to meet specific donor religious criteria.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="10">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and <cite id="11">94.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, including a <cite id="18">100/100 for Culture and Leadership</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity could <cite id="17">expand its board size</cite> beyond the current four members to improve governance oversight.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="5">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> and <cite id="12">verified evidence and outcomes</cite> through rigorous tracking.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="19">publishing consistent beneficiary counts</cite> to allow for standard cost-per-beneficiary assessments.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize extreme financial efficiency and evidence-based health interventions where 100% of their contribution goes directly to the cause.
donor_motivations: Value seeing 100% of their donation used for program materials
Prefer charities with rigorous, data-driven impact tracking
Want to support high-impact health interventions in sub-Saharan Africa
Are comfortable with a secular, highly specialized humanitarian model
giving_considerations: Donations are strictly for net procurement, not general health systems
The organization has a very narrow focus which may not appeal to those seeking holistic development
Governance is lean, which may be a concern for those seeking large institutional boards
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill Zakat obligations or those looking for community-based advocacy and long-term infrastructure development.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade A due to <cite id="12">verified outcomes</cite> and <cite id="8">technical reports</cite> that track net condition and usage over multiple years.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: AMF funds LLINs and works with partners to distribute them, followed by <cite id="7">post-distribution check-ups</cite> to ensure nets are hung and used correctly.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the nets distributed are actually being used by the target population to prevent malaria transmission.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Malaria remains a leading cause of death in its operating regions, and the <cite id="21">recent revenue decline</cite> suggests a significant gap in meeting previous funding levels.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="5">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> and <cite id="6">zero fundraising costs</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses more on advocacy and policy
similar_organizations.name: Malaria No More

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="5">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="6">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring maximum resource allocation to net procurement.
AMF conducts <cite id="7">post-distribution check-ups</cite> and publishes <cite id="8">technical reports on net usage</cite> to verify impact and hanging rates.
The foundation holds a <cite id="11">94/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and a <cite id="10">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: The Against Malaria Foundation's operational model is built on extreme transparency and data verification. By focusing exclusively on <cite id="1">long-lasting insecticidal nets</cite>, they maintain a clear theory of change that is supported by <cite id="12">external evaluation documents</cite>. Their monitoring process is granular; for instance, they track whether nets are <cite id="13">found in very good condition</cite> and the specific number of <cite id="14">households visited for monitoring</cite> during 6-month and 12-month intervals. This level of reporting provides donors with verifiable evidence that their contributions are resulting in tangible protection for at-risk populations.
rich_narrative.summary: The Against Malaria Foundation (US) is a highly specialized humanitarian organization dedicated to the procurement and distribution of <cite id="1">long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs)</cite> to combat malaria globally. Founded in <cite id="2">2003</cite>, the organization has established itself as a leader in cost-effective health interventions, operating extensively across <cite id="3">Africa, Asia, and South America</cite>. In the 2024 fiscal year, the foundation reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $62,286,888</cite>, all of which was derived from contributions. What distinguishes the foundation is its <cite id="5">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that every dollar of public donation is used directly for the purchase of nets. This efficiency is supported by a <cite id="6">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, as private donors often cover the organization's minimal overhead costs. The foundation employs a data-driven approach, utilizing <cite id="7">post-distribution check-ups (PDCUs)</cite> to monitor net usage and condition. For example, technical reports from their monitoring activities track specific metrics such as <cite id="8">net hanging status and the physical state of repair</cite> to ensure long-term efficacy. Despite its high financial efficiency, the organization maintains a <cite id="9">small board of four members</cite>, which impacts its governance score, though it holds a <cite id="10">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.
